items.title: Street Workout & Calisthenics App
items.description: This App helps you to achieve impressive street workout skills and functional muscles. Learn impressive Street Workout & Calisthenics Skills with step by step progressions from beginner to hard levels. As if that were not enough, you can enjoy the bonus section 3+ independent routines available for now. Workout at home, park or at the gym, with your routines in your pocket always offline. Stay with our workouts and notice a change in just a few weeks.

items.title: Jump Rope Training App
items.description: Jumping rope is also a great way to fit in an effective cardio session when you're on the go—just toss your jump rope in your carry-on! You'll probably feel completely energized after jumping rope too. Try adding our workout routines to your existing strength plan, or do it alone as a cardio workout. Add a jump rope to high-intensity interval training (HIIT), and you're in for a hell of a workout.

items.title: Your Daily Cross Training Workouts
items.description: This app is the perfect timer for your workouts. It offers a clear visibility on the clock from far away as well as a simple and beautiful design. Trainings types include Wodzzly app, HIIT and Interval Workouts, such as: EMOM - The next Crossfit Training we support is Every minute on the minute.

items.title: Hula Hoop Training App
items.description: Hula hooping is one of the most popular forms of exercise. Not only is it fun, but it’s incredibly easy. Infer simple steps, anyone can get up and give their hula hoop a spin. 1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the hula hoop at waist height with both hand sand then give it a good spin. 2. Shift your weight between your front and back foot to keep the hula hoop spinning and maintain momentum. 3. Don’t worry if you struggle to maintain momentum and the hula hoop falls. The more you practice, the more your technique will improve.

items.title: 30 Day Jump Rope Challenge App
items.description: 30 Day Jump Rope Challenge - Loss Weight Skipping. Jumping rope is also a great way to fit in an effective cardio session when you're on the go—just toss your jump rope in your carry-on! You'll probably feel completely energized after jumping rope too. Try adding our workout routines to your existing strength plan, or do it alone as a cardio workout. Add a jump rope to high-intensity interval training (HIIT), and you're in for a hell of a workout.

items.title: Resistance Band Training App
items.description: In the world of strength training, resistance bands tend to fly under the radar—especially when compared to heavy hitting equipment like kettlebells and barbells. But what’s not to love about resistance bands? They’re lightweight, versatile, and easy to stow in a gym bag or carry-on, making them an ideal choice for the guy who wants to be able to train anytime, anywhere. You can use them on their own, or add them to more standard exercises to vary up your resistance for a more diverse workout.
